Extract confidence interval limits from vector (of bootstrap resamples)

Source: R/e_CI_limits.R
e_CI_limits.Rd

Extract confidence interval limits from vector (of bootstrap resamples)

e_CI_limits(
  x,
  conf_level = 0.95,
  percentile_lower = NULL,
  percentile_upper = NULL,
  sw_return_exact_CI_coverage = FALSE
)

Arguments

x

vector of values

conf_level

central proportion coverage of interval

percentile_lower

NULL, or lower percentile (0.025) of interval if conf_level not used

percentile_upper

NULL, or upper percentile (0.975) of interval if conf_level not used

sw_return_exact_CI_coverage

T/F, return exact coverage of interval or not

Value

out a named vector of 2 (lower, upper) or 3 (and coverage) values

Examples

x = seq(0, 1, length = 100001) |> sample(replace = TRUE)
e_CI_limits(x)
#>   lower   upper 
#> 0.02452 0.97391 
e_CI_limits(x, sw_return_exact_CI_coverage = TRUE)
#>     lower     upper  coverage 
#> 0.0245200 0.9739100 0.9499905 
e_CI_limits(x, conf_level = 0.80, sw_return_exact_CI_coverage = TRUE)
#>    lower    upper coverage 
#> 0.100770 0.900000 0.799992 
e_CI_limits(x, percentile_lower = 0.01, percentile_upper = 0.90, sw_return_exact_CI_coverage = TRUE)
#> Warning: e_CI_limits:  using percentile limits for CI
#>     lower     upper  coverage 
#> 0.0097900 0.9000000 0.8899911
